programme.title: Going Beyond
programme.desc: Going Beyond is wanderlust-filled hitchhiker Mariia Khandus’s new travel project. She’s journeyed around the world. Everybody knows that Thailand, Vietnam, and Indonesia are great places to relax with wonderful beaches and delicious fruits! But what do you know about the local people? The expats? About the real lives of those living in these exotic countries? In our trip, we will discover it all, together! We visit the non-touristy places and show you the real Indochina! This is a set of stories of different people, through the prism of whom we show life in a country. It is a collection of diverse achievements, experiences and emotions. We are looking for the most interesting stories for you to keep expanding your own consciousness. Unbelievable panoramic views, interesting people, exciting stories and adventures – you’ll see all of this in our travel show, Going Beyond!

programme.title: Gourmet Escapes
programme.desc: Chef Massimo Capra meets chef Uri Navon who’s restaurant islocated in a Kosher neighbourhood, yet serves none kosher food. He connects with Chef Moshe Basson who is very popular in Jerusalem. Chef Massimo visits a mountain cheese maker, navigates the market vendor stalls, tastes everything he can and finds the two ingredients he needs, the tahini and meat for his meal. He does find the time to explore a few attractions along the way.

programme.title: It’s How You Get There
programme.desc: Sam, Julian, and Jenn experience a variety of exciting modes of transportation as they journey across the country. They use things such as trucks, cars and motorcycles, and they also experiment with ATVs, boats, jet skis, and air travel. Each episode features their competition with each other, including wagers, witty banter and adrenaline to keep the viewers entertained. They are continuously learning as they try out these new modes to see which one they consider the best. This is "It's How You Get There".

programme.title: American Travelers
programme.sub-title: American Travelers: Hawaii Rise From the Sea
programme.desc: Dave & Kari visit Hawaii and take a Helicopter tour of the volcano national park.

programme.title: Hayman's Way
programme.desc: Follow David Hayman as he unearths the people and places that make Scotland unique.

programme.title: Raw Travel
programme.desc: Lack of infrastructure be damned, Nicaragua has put its civil war and troubled past behind and is welcoming travelers to experience it’s countless and undiscovered natural wonders. Join the crew as we make our way from earthquake ravaged Managua to the beautiful outposts of León, Granada, Estelí & Lake Omotepe and see why Nicaragua is the hottest up and coming destination in Central America.

programme.title: It’s How You Get There
programme.desc: "It's How You Get There" is hosted by Sam Nehme, Julian Taylor and Jenn Barlow as they journey across the country experiencing different and exciting modes of transportation. If it has a motor, they will ride it, drive it, or fly it. Each episode includes competition and wagers, and of course, adrenaline. These three are always up for a challenge with one thing in mind - winning!

programme.title: American Travelers
programme.sub-title: American Travelers: Hawaii The Big Island
programme.desc: Dave & Kari visit the big island of Hawaii and see some of the most stunning beaches in the world.

programme.title: Hayman's Way
programme.desc: Follow David Hayman as he unearths the people and places that make Scotland unique.

programme.title: Raw Travel
programme.desc: For decades Costa Rica has been luring surfers and eco-travelers to experience its killer waves on the coasts and its unique bio-diversity in the rain forest. We find out why travelers, from first timers to hard core veterans, consistently rave about Costa Rica, Latin America’s undisputed eco-tourism champion. There will be zip-lining (of course!), wild crocodile feeding, bat cave touring, snake handling and a whole lot more!

programme.title: Going Beyond

This is a set of stories of different people, through the prism of whom we show life in a country. It is a collection of diverse achievements, experiences and emotions.
